com.amazon.clouddrive.internal

Class OperationFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazon.clouddrive.internal.OperationFactory

  • public class OperationFactory
extends Object
    Creates operations used by the AmazonCloudDrive clients

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OperationFactory(AccountConfiguration accountConfiguration, ClientConfiguration clientConfiguration)
      Creates an instance of the CloudDriveServiceClient which will not report any metrics when calling operations against Amazon Cloud Drive.

      • OperationFactory

        public OperationFactory(AccountConfiguration accountConfiguration,
                ClientConfiguration clientConfiguration)
        Creates an instance of the CloudDriveServiceClient which will not report any metrics when calling operations against Amazon Cloud Drive.
        Parameters:
        accountConfiguration - Holds all of the account configuration options for AmazonCloudDriveClient
        clientConfiguration - Holds all of the configuration options for the CloudDriveServiceClient.

      • newGetAccountEndpointOperation

        public CloudDriveOperation<GetAccountEndpointResponse> newGetAccountEndpointOperation(GetAccountEndpointRequest request)

        Retrieves the current account's endpoint information from Amazon Cloud Drive. This includes the account's retail URL, content URL, and its meta data URL.

      • newGetAccountQuotaOperation

        public CloudDriveOperation<GetAccountQuotaResponse> newGetAccountQuotaOperation(GetAccountQuotaRequest request)

        Retrieves the current account's quota information from Amazon Cloud Drive. The GetAccountQuotaResponse.getQuota() and GetAccountQuotaResponse.getAvailable() are in bytes and the String contained in GetAccountQuotaResponse.getLastCalculated() is the last date and time the quota was calculated.

        Expected possible exceptions on CloudDriveOperation.call():

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable

        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters for a get quota request.
        Returns:
        An HTTP operation which defines how to retrieve an account's quota information.

        public CloudDriveOperation<GetAccountUsageResponse> newGetAccountUsageOperation(GetAccountUsageRequest request)

        Retrieves the current account's usage information from Amazon Cloud Drive. Note that GetAccountUsageResponse.getLastCalculated() is the last date and time the usage was calculated.

      • newGetChangesOperation

        public <U extends IGetChangesResponse> CloudDriveOperation<U> newGetChangesOperation(GetChangesRequest request,
                                                                            JsonDeserializer<U> deserializer)

        Retrieves a set of nodes which represent changes since a given checkpoint. If the GetChangesRequest.setCheckpoint(String) has not been called, then this request will return the earliest modified nodes. To get the next list of modified nodes, pass the checkpoint that was associated with the previous call to the request of the next call (i.e. changeRequest.setCheckpoint(String) from changes.getCheckpoint()). To retrieve all changes, keep calling this method until the GetChangesResponse.getNodes() is empty.

        Expected possible exceptions on CloudDriveOperation.call():

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable

        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters for a get changes request.
        Returns:
        An HTTP operation which defines how to retrieve the list of nodes associated with a given checkpoint.

      • newListNodesOperation

        public <T extends PaginatedCloudDriveResponse> CloudDriveOperation<T> newListNodesOperation(ListNodesRequest request,
                                                                                   JsonDeserializer<T> deserializer)

        Lists nodes for the current account contained in Amazon Cloud Drive. Listing particular nodes is controlled by the request passed in through the parameter. The responses are paginated and particular pages can be selected from the given request.

        Expected possible exceptions on CloudDriveOperation.call():

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable

        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters for a list node request.
        Returns:
        An HTTP operation which defines how to retrieve a list of nodes for an account.

      • newCreateNodeOperation

        public <T extends INode> CloudDriveOperation<T> newCreateNodeOperation(CreateNodeRequest request,
                                                              JsonDeserializer<T> deserializer)

        Creates a node with the provided parameters defined in the provided PostNodeRequest. The required parameters that need to be set are:

        • EditableNodeRequest.setName(String)
        • EditableNodeRequest.setKind(String)
        An optional parameter is PostNodeRequest.getLocalId() and can be used to deduplicate node creation from a single client.

        Expected possible exceptions on CloudDriveOperation.call():

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable

        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters for creating a node.
        Returns:
        The meta-data for the new node.

      • newUploadFileOperation

        public <T extends INode> CloudDriveOperation<T> newUploadFileOperation(UploadFileRequest request,
                                                              ProgressListener progressListener,
                                                              JsonDeserializer<T> deserializer)

        Creates a file with the provided parameters defined in the provided UploadFileRequest. The required parameters that need to be set are:

        • EditableNodeRequest.setName(String)
        • EditableNodeRequest.setKind(String)
        • EditableNodeRequest.setContentProperties(com.amazon.clouddrive.model.ContentProperties), where the ContentProperties.setContentType(String) has been set.
        • UploadFileRequest.setContentLength(long). This must be greater than 0 and should be the size of the file being uploaded.
        An optional parameters are:
        • PostNodeRequest.getLocalId() and can be used to deduplicate node creation from a single client.
        • UploadFileRequest.setSuppress(com.amazon.clouddrive.model.Suppress)

        In addition to the above parameters. There is a choice between using a fixed length streaming mode or a chunked streaming mode, defined by the flag UploadFileRequest.useChunkedStreaming(). If this flag is set to true, then an other option is used to determine how big the chunks should be. Set through UploadFileRequest.setChunkSize(int). Otherwise, the system default is used. This is useful for runtime environments whose implementation of fixed streaming mode will read the stream into memory prior to sending through the network stack. In general, the default fixed streaming mode is sufficient.

        Expected possible exceptions on CloudDriveOperation.call():

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable

        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters for uploading a file as well as the file itself.
        Returns:
        The meta-data for the file that was uploaded.

      • newUpdateNodeOperation

        public <T extends INode> CloudDriveOperation<T> newUpdateNodeOperation(UpdateNodeRequest request,
                                                              JsonDeserializer<T> deserializer)

        Updates a node with the specified id with any of the non-null values present in the request. The UpdateNodeRequest.setId(String) is required to be set to determine which node will receive the updates.

        Expected possible exceptions on CloudDriveOperation.call():

        • SystemUnavailable

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The updated node info wrapped.

      • newAddPropertyOperation

        public CloudDriveOperation<AddNodePropertyResponse> newAddPropertyOperation(AddNodePropertyRequest request)

        Adds a property for the given node. Note that there can only be 10 properties for any given owner. The required parameters that need to be set on the given request are:

        • id: The id of the node to receive the property.
        • owner: The friendly name of the application creating the property.
        • key: The key of the property being created. Maximum length 50 characters following the pattern [A-Z0-9a-z_]+
        • value: The value of the property being created. Maximum length 500 characters.

        Expected possible exceptions on CloudDriveOperation.call():

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable

        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters to create a property.
        Returns:
        The added property.

      • newListPropertiesOperation

        public CloudDriveOperation<ListNodePropertiesResponse> newListPropertiesOperation(ListNodePropertiesRequest request)

        Lists properties for the given node and owner. The required parameters that need to be set on the given request are:

        • id: The id of the node to receive the property.
        • owner: The friendly name of the application creating the property.

        Expected possible exceptions on CloudDriveOperation.call():

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable

        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters to list the properties for a given node and owner.
        Returns:
        The list of properties associated with the provided owner for the given node.

      • newDeletePropertyOperation

        public CloudDriveOperation<Void> newDeletePropertyOperation(DeleteNodePropertyRequest request)

        Removes a property for the given node associated with a given owner. The required parameters that need to be set on the given request are:

        • id: The id of the node to receive the property.
        • owner: The friendly name of the application creating the property.
        • key: The key of the property being created. Maximum length 50 characters following the pattern [A-Z0-9a-z_]+

      • newListChildrenOperation

        public <T extends PaginatedCloudDriveResponse> CloudDriveOperation<T> newListChildrenOperation(ListChildrenRequest request,
                                                                                      JsonDeserializer<T> deserializer)

        Lists nodes which are child nodes of a given node id for the current account in Amazon Cloud Drive. The responses are paginated and particular pages can be selected from the given request. The setting of ListChildrenRequest.setId(String) is required before being passed as a parameter; otherwise, a InvalidParameter exception will be thrown.

        Expected possible exceptions on CloudDriveOperation.call():

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable

        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters for a list children request.
        Returns:
        An HTTP operation which defines how to retrieve a list of children for a given node id.

      • newRemoveChildFromParentOperation

        public CloudDriveOperation<Void> newRemoveChildFromParentOperation(RemoveChildFromParentRequest request)

        Removes a child from its specified parent. Currently there are two different behaviors when a node will have no parents after this operation. If the node is a folder, that node will remain without any parents. If the node is a file, then that node will be deleted. The childId and parentId are required to be populated prior to giving a RemoveChildFromParentRequest to this method.

        Expected possible exceptions on CloudDriveOperation.call():

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable

        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters for removing a child from one of its parents.
        Returns:
        null

      • newAddChildToParentOperation

        public CloudDriveOperation<Void> newAddChildToParentOperation(AddChildToParentRequest request)

        Adds a child from its specified parent. The childId and parentId are required to be populated prior to giving a RemoveChildFromParentRequest to this method.

        Expected possible exceptions on CloudDriveOperation.call():

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure

        • SystemUnavailable

      • newMoveNodeToTrashOperation

        public CloudDriveOperation<MoveNodeToTrashResponse> newMoveNodeToTrashOperation(MoveNodeToTrashRequest request)

        Moves a node defined by the request to the trash. If the id has not been set on the given request, then there will be an InvalidParameter thrown.

        Expected possible exceptions on CloudDriveOperation.call():

        • InvalidParameter
        • BadToken
        • Forbidden
        • ResourceNotFound
        • ConflictError
        • PreConditionFailure
        • TooManyRequests
        • SystemFault
        • SystemUnavailable

        Parameters:
        request - Holds all possible parameters for moving a node to the trash.
        Returns:
        The meta-data for the node that was moved to the trash.

      • newRestoreNodeFromTrashOperation

        public <T extends INode> CloudDriveOperation<T> newRestoreNodeFromTrashOperation(RestoreNodeFromTrashRequest request,
                                                                        JsonDeserializer<T> deserializer)

        Moves a node defined by the request out of the trash. If the id has not been set on the given request, then there will be an InvalidParameter thrown.

        Returns:
        The meta-data for the node which was moved from the trash.

      • clearEndpoints

        public void clearEndpoints()
        Call this method whenever requests should stop using the endpoints that they have currently been using. For example, if an account has been deregistered or if the lifespan has been reached for the endpoints. It is recommended that new endpoints be fetched daily.
